title: Functions: Domain, Range, and Notation

vocab.definition: Relation where each input has exactly one output
Set of all possible input values (x-values)
Set of all possible output values (y-values)
Writing functions as f(x) instead of y
Method to determine if a graph represents a function

teachingNotes: Emphasize the definition of function and use various representations. Practice reading function notation and finding domain/range.

sample.question: What is a relation where each input has exactly one output?
What is the vertical line test?
expectedAny: test to check if graph is a function

sample.question: Give an example of a function.

truefalse.question: The domain is the set of all possible input values. (True or False)
The range is the set of all possible input values. (True or False)
Each input can have multiple outputs in a function. (True or False)
f(x) is function notation. (True or False)
The vertical line test checks if a relation is a function. (True or False)
Domain refers to y-values. (True or False)
Range refers to y-values. (True or False)
A function must pass the vertical line test. (True or False)
f(3) means the input is 3. (True or False)
Every relation is a function. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What test determines if a graph represents a function?
What is the set of all possible input values?
What is the set of all possible output values?
In a function, each input has how many outputs?
If f(2) = 5, what is the input?
If f(2) = 5, what is the output?

fillintheblank.question: The set of all possible output values is called the _____.
The set of all possible input values is called the _____.
A relation where each input has one output is a _____.
Writing f(x) instead of y is called _____ notation.
The _____ line test checks if a graph is a function.
In f(x), the result is the _____.
If a vertical line crosses a graph twice, it is not a _____.
f(3) = 7 means when input is 3, output is _____.

shortanswer.question: How do you use the vertical line test?
expectedAny: Draw vertical lines; if any crosses more than once, not a function
Each vertical line should cross graph at most once
Vertical line crosses only once for functions

shortanswer.question: Why is {(1,2), (1,3)} not a function?
expectedAny: Same input cannot have multiple outputs

shortanswer.question: What is the difference between domain and range?
expectedAny: Domain is inputs, range is outputs
Domain is x-values, range is y-values
Domain is all inputs, range is all outputs

shortanswer.question: How do you find the domain of a function?
How do you find the range of a function?
What makes a relation a function?
expectedAny: Each input has exactly one output
Every input maps to single output

shortanswer.question: Can two inputs have the same output in a function?
expectedAny: Yes, different inputs can have same output
Yes, multiple inputs can map to one output

shortanswer.question: Why use function notation f(x) instead of y?
expectedAny: Easier to work with multiple functions

wordProblems.question: What is the domain of f(x) = x + 2?
If f(2) = 10 and f(3) = 15, what is f(2)?
